column1: Kadogo and Juma are friends who love running. They run together every day. One day they were reading maps at school. Juma said
column2: "Let's run across our continent. Let's race
column3: together with Africans from many countries!" "Let's go
column4: we can do it! African unity!" cheered Kadogo. They decided to carry a unity torch on their journey. They lit the torch and began to run. The race started at the southern tip of our continent
column6: South Africa. From South Africa they headed along the west coast. They ran through Namibia
column9: Congo and Cameroon. Runners quickly joined them from these countries. The growing group of people rested in Nigeria
column10: in Abuja. More runners from West Africa joined the friends as they passed through Nigeria. They continued together
column11: following the River Niger. A sandstorm in Mali made it difficult to run. Juma was the strongest of all of them. He led the way safely
column12: holding the unity torch high. At Guinea's coast in Conakry the dusty runners washed in the sea. Then they decided to race to Morocco through Senegal and Mauritania. All the way
